page.title: 05Education in Southam
page.content: Southam is well catered for in the educational sense. Children can start school at three years of age by attending the nursery department of St.Mary's R.C. Combined School. At four and a half to five years old, children start full time education either attending Southam's First and Middle Schools or St.Mary's R.C. They stay in primary education until they are twelve. There is a C.of E. First school where children attend until the age of eight. At twelve some children transfer to Southam School. Here they pursue subjects to C.S.E.,16 plus, O and A level standards. Other children travel to Leamington and Warwick by bus to attend schools there. After success at A level, children may then go to a university or college to continue their studies. Warwick University is nearest to Southam.
